column1: Pfizer about to seek emergency use authorization for its COVID 19 vaccine. The vaccine is 95% effective even in older adults with no safety concerns. Could  be ready by end of the year. This is great news! https://t.co/r9HfQ61s8Z

BREAKING: Manatee County could lose as much as $30 million in COVID funds if Congress fails to act by Dec. 30. I’m urging congressional leaders to extend the arbitrary deadline. See my letter here: https://t.co/tmolUTL13e

Our community has been hit hard by coronavirus and shouldn’t be penalized by an arbitrary deadline to use these funds. I will be speaking to Congressional leaders about extending this deadline to ensure that families and businesses continue to get the help they need. https://t.co/vZFMP57R1b

Speaker Pelosi Senate Leader McConnell and Treasury Secretary Mnuchin need to get back to the table and negotiate a compromise on coronavirus relief. People are still hurting and the economy is on shaky ground. Let's focus on the many points of agreement and get it done!
Wishing @POTUS and @FLOTUS well after their COVID-19 diagnosis. Speedy recovery to both.

The Pentagon is blaming the pandemic for a 20% increase in military suicides this year. Even before COVID I urged the Pentagon to address military suicides and introduced legislation to tackle the problem. We need to do a better job helping our veterans. https://t.co/bjgbn8JMws

TODAY I’m urging the Trump administration to make the COVID  vaccine free to seniors on Medicare. Seniors are especially vulnerable to this deadly disease. We need to make sure they have access to a vaccine. Read my letter here to HHS Secretary Azar. https://t.co/cqehb4t4AR
Good to hear Speaker Pelosi now wants to negotiate a compromise on coronavirus relief. People are still hurting and need our help. Let’s get it done!

Speaker Pelosi needs to come back to the table and help negotiate a deal on coronavirus relief. People need our help with unemployment benefits and stimulus checks. We also need a COVID liability shield for hospitals schools businesses and non-profits. Let's get it done!

Just had a great call with the @ManateeChamber on how we can help small businesses recover from the impact of coronavirus and create new jobs. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and when they succeed the American people succeed.

The political posturing in Washington must end. Millions of Americans are hurting and need help. Speaker Pelosi and Senate Leader McConnell must address unemployment benefits and other COVID-related relief including school safety. The House returns Saturday - let’s get it done!

Manatee County has created a grant program for local nonprofits and community organizations using funding provided by the CARES Act. Grants can be used to purchase PPE and support more COVID testing. Read the details and apply at the link below. https://t.co/hKx260ivfH

Governor DeSantis should accept the President’s offer to extend unemployment benefits to Floridians. People are hurting and need help now. Pelosi and McConnell need to keep negotiating and come up with a COVID relief package that addresses school safety and other issues.

Hurricane experts just updated their forecast to an “extremely active” season with the potential to be the “busiest on record.“ The coronavirus poses even more challenges. Floridians need to prepare now. https://t.co/2aAa5hoCz3
Thank you to Sarasota native Jonathan Brewer a hospital corpsman in the U.S. Navy who is helping to keep sailors safe from coronavirus. https://t.co/xTLOFr4wqw https://t.co/CM4zhMCpjA

Coronavirus has exposed how dangerously reliant our medical supply chain is on China and other countries. That’s why today I wrote to congressional leaders to include my bill to revive America’s medical supply chain in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/u4qAVqbSU9 https://t.co/jDYKIDw02H

Great talking with my former intern Emmabella a strong voice for the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation. Managing diabetes during the COVID-19 outbreak is especially important. Thank you Emmabella for your work to help raise awareness of Type 1 Diabetes.

.@ManateeGov is now requiring face masks be worn inside all businesses when social distancing is not possible. Wearing protective face masks is one of the most effective ways to avoid spreading coronavirus. https://t.co/LfE7Oon4ve

The drug Remdesivir is proven to help people infected with COVID-19. Florida hospitals are in short supply. That’s why I just sent a letter with my Florida colleagues to the Trump administration requesting more for one of the hardest hit states. Read the letter here. https://t.co/G1dDvU2hXF

The coronavirus continues to be a serious threat to seniors and individuals with underlying health conditions. That’s why it’s vital for Floridians to stay vigilant and take all possible precautions to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/9xJ5AVV0Nf
As the coronavirus continues to spread wearing protective face masks is one of the smartest ways to avoid infection. In some places it’s required. Read below to see where.   https://t.co/QQkNo4G2Wi

The explosion of opioid overdoses in Sarasota County during the coronavirus pandemic is both tragic and alarming. That’s why I'm fighting for more funding for treatment for those in need in Southwest Florida. https://t.co/DUZWhQeuhb
Heading out of town this holiday weekend? Take a look at this helpful list of recommendations for traveling in the age of coronavirus.    https://t.co/BKR50i0BsU
As COVID-19 cases rise in Florida the state Health Department is urging everyone to wear protective face masks. See the details here. https://t.co/QnxKLxGUUE

Manatee and Sarasota have 1st and 2nd highest number of COVID-19 deaths among FLA counties yet to receive federal relief funds. That’s why I’m calling for significant funding for those counties to keep people safe and help our community recover. https://t.co/QK4YA6vLyv

Just spoke with state emergency management director Jared Moskowitz to discuss hurricane preparedness amid coronavirus. I’m pleased to see Florida incorporating safety and social distancing practices into their evacuation and shelter guidelines to protect people. https://t.co/OX0cVgbxOj

Pleased to announce that @ManateeGov and @ManateeSheriff have received a $350000 federal coronavirus grant for personal protective equipment and other critical supplies. This funding will go a long way to help combat the spread of COVID-19 in Manatee County.

More than 80 percent of COVID-19 deaths in Florida have been people 65 years and older. More federal resources need to go toward protecting seniors in assisted living facilities. Read the letter I sent to the Secretary of the federal Department of Health and Human Services. https://t.co/tMOl3FXy2A
While protecting yourself from coronavirus don’t ignore medical emergencies that may require a visit to the doctor. Read below and see why: https://t.co/OMTCZKb1l8

More great news for the Suncoast! Pleased to announce the City of Bradenton has received a $74000 coronavirus grant to provide personal protective equipment for our first responders. We appreciate all you do for our community!
Pleased to announce the @CityofSarasota has received a $75000 coronavirus grant to provide personal protective equipment for our first responders. Thank you for protecting our community!
Great tele-town hall tonight with area residents on the coronavirus. A special thanks to Dr. Jennifer Bencie Manatee County’s public health officer for joining me on the call. https://t.co/QVPMSIuszQ

Tonight at 7pm I’ll be joining @JMatter_TV on @mysuncoast to answer your coronavirus related questions and discuss what I’ve been fighting for in Congress. You can watch live on the link here: https://t.co/yUKEp3Hol5 https://t.co/TWLTOfO0eA

Healthcare workers are putting themselves on the front line to save lives during the coronavirus pandemic. A special thanks to @SMHCS Dr. Manuel Gordillo for his hard work and for taking the time to answer some common questions. https://t.co/0sNN8lrngv

China's cover-up of COVID-19 is well documented. I just co-sponsored a bill to amend the Foreign Sovereign Immunities Act and allow Americans to sue China. Their deceit has led to 80000 American deaths. China must be held accountable! https://t.co/GrVsAgxfgK

Today we celebrate the 75th anniversary of the Allied victory over Nazi Germany. While our country has faced many great challenges as we do now with the #coronavirus pandemic I know that together we will endure and emerge stronger and more united than ever before. https://t.co/A7yOvq2M8s

Pleased to announce that our area has received more coronavirus healthcare aid than 95 percent of the rest of the country. My congressional district was 19th out of 435 districts. Our doctors and nurses are doing heroic work -- they deserve it!  https://t.co/ltK1moesO0

Thanks to all who joined me on my telephone town hall to discuss the latest on the coronavirus pandemic and phase one of Gov. DeSantis’s plan to safely reopen Florida. A special thank you to Sarasota County’s Public Health Officer Chuck Henry for lending his expertise. https://t.co/8ppoao92gF

Coronavirus has shown how dangerously reliant we are on China for life-saving medicines. China recently threatened to cut off access to these vital drugs. Today I introduced legislation in the U.S. House to rebuild drug manufacturing in America.

Americans are struggling with mental health issues including depression and social isolation due to COVID-19. Seniors are especially vulnerable. Phone calls to crisis hotlines have jumped 900%. The next coronavirus relief bill needs to address this. https://t.co/2nN30o38gf

ICYMI: The state is opening five new drive-thru coronavirus testing sites across the state including one at the Mall at University Town Center next week to serve Manatee and Sarasota counties. Find out more here.  https://t.co/n4SMuU16bh
Looking forward to joining @JMatter_TV on @mysuncoast and answering your questions on coronavirus. Tune in tonight at 7pm! https://t.co/o728qhNSST

The Florida Department of Health in Manatee County is offering drive-thru testing this week. If you’re a Manatee County resident and exhibiting symptoms of coronavirus please call 941-748-0747 to make an appointment and see below for more information. https://t.co/8exWjNVT2m

Another great telephone town hall on the #coronavirus with Dr. Jennifer Bencie Manatee County’s public health director. Thank you to all the area residents for your great questions. Your health and safety is my number one priority. https://t.co/gl3YByyFmg

As coronavirus continues to disrupt lives in Florida and across the country it’s inspiring to see so many people helping others get through this crisis. Read the article below to find out more on the ‘Giving Challenge.' https://t.co/csTetc0pM2

Manatee and Sarasota counties have been hit hard by coronavirus. Yet both counties are ineligible for relief funds because of an arbitrary population threshold. I'm working to change that in the next relief bill to come before Congress. https://t.co/j0brZ5Al0y

Earlier this month I urged the governor to make unemployment benefits retroactive for people who lost their job due to coronavirus. Glad to see he has done so. Anyone who lost their job since March 9 will now get retroactive payments.

Kudos to Secretary of State Pompeo for calling on China to shut down their animal "wet” markets where coronavirus may have originated. My colleague @RepHastingsFL and I urged the White House to do so last week. https://t.co/UGlVZMivMi

Bipartisan deal finally reached on the next coronavirus relief bill. This aid package will provide much-needed help for America's workers and struggling small businesses. Also includes money for hospitals and expanded testing.
President Trump plans to suspend immigration into the United States during the coronavirus pandemic. I support his action do you?

Pleased to see U.S. Sens. Klobuchar Cantwell Boozman and Kennedy echo my call for local news outlets to be eligible for relief under the Paycheck Protection Program. Local news plays a key role in keeping us informed during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/yIfPzZ9zY8 https://t.co/MAVeQiqlpQ

My Florida colleague @RepHastingsFL and I just wrote to President Trump condemning China's live animal markets that serve as incubators for deadly viruses like coronavirus. Our letter urges Trump to demand that China impose strict regulation of these so-called "wet markets." https://t.co/F4aMDEX4DV
Thousands of hardworking Floridians in my district and across the state have been laid off and are facing untold economic hardships as a result of the coronavirus.

As the public relies on local news for COVID-19 info reporters are facing layoffs and furloughs due to declining ad revenue. I asked congressional leaders today to consider including financially troubled local news outlets in their next relief package. Read my full letter below. https://t.co/6qqm728FeT

Tune in tonight at 7:00 p.m. to watch @mysuncoast.  I will be joining @JMatter_TV to answer your questions on the #coronavirus and discuss what Congress is doing to help you and your family during this difficult time. https://t.co/d8vIvyDeKk

As some media outlets in our district reduce or furlough employees due to COVID-19 I want to express my appreciation for all they do to keep people informed. The press plays a unique role in helping all of us follow safety protocols. Thank you!

Just finished another tele-town hall on the #coronavirus with area residents. Lots of great questions. Special thanks to Dr. Jennifer Bencie Manatee County’s public health director who helped answer questions. https://t.co/mHeimIS3Qg
Take a look at this helpful tip sheet for some simple steps you can take to “coronavirus-proof” your home and help protect you and your family.  https://t.co/IXMFyAGAxj

Spoke with Miami-Dade Mayor Carlos Gimenez last night and he assured me that all six of our neighbors from Bradenton and Sarasota are healthy and have disembarked after being screened from the cruise ship Coral Princess. Not everyone on board was as fortunate some with COVID-19.

I fully support the stay-at-home order issued by Gov. DeSantis because it reinforces that people should be taking serious steps to avoid spreading the COVID-19 virus. I have been getting calls recently from people throughout our region hoping the governor would take such action.

On #NationalDoctorsDay I want to recognize the incredible sacrifices made by doctors nurses and medical staff who are working tirelessly on the frontlines of the #coronavirus pandemic. Our country thanks you for your courage selflessness and for putting your patients first.

Most taxpayers will get direct cash payments from the government under the new coronavirus relief bill. It’s automatic for people who have filed a tax return or received Social Security benefits recently. Click here to see how much you may be eligible for. https://t.co/J0qPLG8g2m

A #coronavirus rescue package to protect Americans and stabilize the economy was approved moments ago by the U.S. House. The President is expected to swiftly sign into law. Read my statement below. https://t.co/OJoXxKSVsj

Help is on the way now that the Senate has passed 96-0 a sweeping economic aid bill to combat coronavirus. Payments to taxpayers loans for businesses and aid for hospitals are included. House to approve bill tomorrow followed by the President's signature. https://t.co/9AsjerDDoz

Just held a tele-town hall on the #coronavirus with area residents. The Manatee County Public Health Director Doctor Jennifer Bencie was a special guest on the call. A lot of great questions were asked and answered. https://t.co/EbBdgPGJvr

With coronavirus continuing to spread rapidly across the country make sure you know the symptoms so you can recognize them early. If you think that you have been exposed to the coronavirus use the link below and contact your local health dept. https://t.co/Eck6nFQlGc https://t.co/zfeq4DuK04

The Senate needs to put aside partisan bickering and pass an emergency rescue bill. Millions of people are depending on it. The economic impact of coronavirus is going to be devastating for families and small businesses here in Florida and across the country. We need action now!

The @StateDept has issued the highest level travel advisory warning Americans against international travel due to the #coronavirus. I encourage you to enroll in the Smart Traveler Enrollment Program to receive the most up-to-date travel information here. https://t.co/bFJSTSunzS

Special shout-out to our local news organizations for keeping the public informed about the #coronavirus. Thank you @mysuncoast @bradentonherald @HeraldTribune @Fla_Pol and @SNNTV. You’re making a difference!

.@ManateeSheriff is warning about coronavirus-related scams. Scammers are claiming to be with the CDC and offering to let people "reserve a vaccine for COVID-19." Take a look at the article below on how to avoid becoming a victim https://t.co/oyRqp9x4vp. https://t.co/IzoywhA29A

BREAKING: The U.S. Senate just passed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act providing free testing as well as paid emergency leave. We need to help people who are economically impacted by this deadly disease.

With more than 220000 Social Security recipients in our area it’s imperative our seniors continue to receive the help they need from the Social Security Administration. Here is what you need to know about SSA office closures during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/oO7q6QyXlq
Pleased to see the federal gov’t announce that it will grant most taxpayers an additional 90 days to pay their income taxes due to the #coronavirus.    https://t.co/QD21b6OEWD
The Florida Department of Health launched a new dashboard with the latest information on #COVID19 cases in Florida.   Click here to visit their new website and stay informed. https://t.co/imq5Yt3Fcq

Just got off the phone with three Florida medical experts who said social distancing is the single best way to stop #coronavirus. Thank you for all your hard work to keep us safe Drs. Manuel Gordillo David Nelson and Dean Hautamaki.

The U.S. House early today approved a coronavirus relief bill that will provide free testing for all Americans. The Families First Coronavirus Response Act which I voted for also includes paid emergency leave and enhanced unemployment insurance. The bill now goes to the Senate.

With the @WHO officially designating #coronavirus a global pandemic we need a strong response to confront this threat. That’s why @RepHastingsFL and I just called for significant resources to help our state contain the outbreak and ensure the safety of all Floridians. https://t.co/e7XSsbnMyb

Just came from a briefing on the #coronavirus at the U.S. Dept. of Health and Human Services in D.C. Told them they need to do a better job of working with state health agencies to keep the public informed with accurate and timely information. https://t.co/k2S1UPw2jn

Just met with Blake Medical Center staff about coronavirus. Public education is critical. COVID-19 should not be taken lightly especially for seniors. This is going to get worse before it gets better. We have a lot of work to do. https://t.co/U7y3RyfOot

Just met with @SMHCS President David Verinder and his team of medical experts to discuss preparation for coronavirus in Florida. Offered my assistance in helping to educate the public and deliver federal aid. https://t.co/B8RHfLkZPe

Just met with Doctors Hospital of Sarasota CEO Robert Meade to discuss treatment of a presumptive coronavirus patient. He assured me they are taking all necessary precautions. He emphasized that if you're in good health it's unlikely that you would suffer serious complications. https://t.co/tgihGrGrx9

As @GovRonDeSantis declares a public health emergency Congress needs to make sure we have the resources to properly test for and contain COVID-19. When I return to Washington this week I will fight for swift passage of a coronavirus funding bill.   https://t.co/PR4zuIwtW4

As the Trump administration requests funds to address the deadly #Coronavirus Congress cannot afford to take this threat lightly. We need to devote whatever resources are necessary to protect the public and contain this rapidly-spreading virus.

Glad to see Health and Human Services Secretary Azar declare a public health emergency over deadly #coronavirus. I urged him earlier this week to do so to protect Americans. We need to take every precaution.

As the World Health Organization upgrades its global risk assessment for the coronavirus outbreak to “high” it’s important for the U.S. to take precautions. Safeguards now could save lives later especially with a virus we have never encountered before. https://t.co/HZyH8Ku0fO
